name: clinker production | clinker | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/29173/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg clinker in Ecuador. Clinker is the main constituent of cement and the main responsible for its environmental impacts. The data is obtained for the year 2019 from the publication of Petroche & Ramirez (2022), based on information from factories. ;Reference: ;Petroche, D. M., & Ramirez, A. D. (2022). The Environmental Profile of Clinker, Cement, and Concrete: A Life Cycle Perspective Study Based on Ecuadorian Data. Buildings, 12(3), 311.

The activity starts from the reception of raw materials at the clinker manufacturing plant.

The activity ends with the production of clinker at the factory gate. The activity includes the processing of materials and their transport within the factory gates. The dataset does not include the packaging.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is 2019 (year of the data collection) to 2023 (year of the compilation of the dataset).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset is representative of the production of clinker in Ecuador.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current technology. Clinker is made by heating at high temperature in a rotary kiln a mixture of limestone and clays. In the production of clinker, 86% of the total raw materials are composed of limestone. Four types of clays are used, which come from different parts of ;Ecuador; these clays represent 11% by mass, and other raw materials of mineral correction ;represent 3%.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The amount of limestone differs from the study in order to close the mass balance. This was also confirmed with the author of the study, who stated that in the study certain residues which go back into the system were not considered.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
The dataset is based on the data available in Petroche & Ramirez (2022). In this study, information was obtained in factories from: plants’ sustainability reports, registering systems, emission-monitoring system, biannual measurement reports, consumption reports and logistics records. Specifically, material and energy inputs to produce clinker were obtained from plants' sustainability reports. Access was provided to the data of the registering system of raw materials consumption, fuels, and electricity use in each phase of the system. Monthly emission data for CO2, NOx, SO2, PM, and VOCs was obtained from the continuous emission-monitoring system of each clinker kiln. Pollutant emissions such as ammonia, antimony, arsenic, benzene, cadmium, hydrogen chloride, cobalt, copper, chromium, dioxins, mercury, carbon monoxide, nickel, lead, thallium, and vanadium were obtained from the biannual measurement reports of each clinker kiln. Reports on the consumption of oils, heavy machinery, and maintenance equipment were obtained from logistics records.
The datasets for clinker and cement represent 62.8% of the production in Ecuador, according to Petroche (2021).

Reference: 
Petroche, D. M., & Ramirez, A. D. (2022). The environmental profile of clinker, cement, and concrete: a life cycle perspective study based on ecuadorian data. Buildings, 12(3), 311.
Petroche, D. (2021). Desempeño Ambiental del Cemento y del Concreto en el Ecuador: Una puerta a la Construcción Sostenible [Master’s degree thesis in  Industrial Eco-efficiency, Escuela Superior Politécnica del Litoral]. https://www.dspace.espol.edu.ec/bitstream/123456789/52614/1/T-88998%20%20DANIEL%20PETROCHE%20S%C3%81NCHEZ.pdf

M., & Ramirez, A. D. (2022). The Environmental Profile of Clinker, Cement, and Concrete: A Life Cycle Perspective Study Based on Ecuadorian Data. Buildings, 12(3), 311.

Literature value. The location of the factories of the suppliers of the main raw materials was determined, then an optimal route was generated using global positioning system (GPS) tools. Finally, using the weights of the raw materials, the transportation was expressed in t*km (Petroche & Ramirez, 2022).  Reference: Petroche, D. M., & Ramirez, A. D. (2022). The Environmental Profile of Clinker, Cement, and Concrete: A Life Cycle Perspective Study Based on Ecuadorian Data. Buildings, 12(3), 311.
